verses.verse: And <S%H4872>Moses<s%> <S%H1696>spoke<s%> unto the <S%H7218>heads<s%> of the <S%H4294>tribes<s%> concerning the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, This is the <S%H1697>thing<s%> which the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> has <S%H6680>commanded<s%>.

If a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H5087>vow<s%> a <S%H5088>vow<s%> unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, or <S%H7650>swear<s%> an <S%H7621>oath<s%> to <S%H631>bind<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%> with a <S%H632>bond<s%>; he shall not <S%H2490>break<s%> his <S%H1697>word<s%>, he shall <S%H6213>do<s%> according to all that <S%H3318>proceeds<s%> out of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%>.

If a <S%H802>woman<s%> also <S%H5087>vow<s%> a <S%H5088>vow<s%> unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, and <S%H631>bind<s%> herself by a <S%H632>bond<s%>, being in her <S%H1>father<s%>'s <S%H1004>house<s%> in her <S%H5271>youth<s%>;

And her <S%H1>father<s%> <S%H8085>hear<s%> her <S%H5088>vow<s%>, and her <S%H632>bond<s%> with which she has <S%H631>bound<s%> her <S%H5315>soul<s%>, and her <S%H1>father<s%> shall hold his <S%H2790>peace<s%> at <S%H5088>her<s%>: then all her vows shall <S%H6965>stand<s%>, and every <S%H632>bond<s%> with which she has <S%H631>bound<s%> her <S%H5315>soul<s%> shall <S%H6965>stand<s%>.

But if her <S%H1>father<s%> <S%H5106>disallow<s%> her in the <S%H3117>day<s%> that he <S%H8085>hears<s%>; not any of her <S%H5088>vows<s%>, or of her <S%H632>bonds<s%> with which she has <S%H631>bound<s%> her <S%H5315>soul<s%>, shall <S%H6965>stand<s%>: and the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> shall <S%H5545>forgive<s%> <S%H1>her<s%>, because her father disallowed <S%H5106>her<s%>.
And if she had at all an <S%H376>husband<s%>, when she <S%H5088>vowed<s%>, or <S%H4008>uttered<s%> ought out of her <S%H8193>lips<s%>, with which she <S%H631>bound<s%> her <S%H5315>soul<s%>;

And her <S%H376>husband<s%> <S%H8085>heard<s%> <S%H2790>it<s%>, and held his peace at her in the <S%H3117>day<s%> that he <S%H8085>heard<s%> <S%H5088>it<s%>: then her vows shall <S%H6965>stand<s%>, and her <S%H632>bonds<s%> with which she <S%H631>bound<s%> her <S%H5315>soul<s%> shall <S%H6965>stand<s%>.

But if her <S%H376>husband<s%> <S%H5106>disallowed<s%> her on the <S%H3117>day<s%> that he <S%H8085>heard<s%> <S%H5088>it<s%>; then he shall make her vow which she vowed, and that which she <S%H4008>uttered<s%> with her <S%H8193>lips<s%>, with which she <S%H631>bound<s%> her <S%H5315>soul<s%>, of none <S%H6565>effect<s%>: and the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> shall forgive <S%H5545>her<s%>.
But every <S%H5088>vow<s%> of a <S%H490>widow<s%>, and of her that is <S%H1644>divorced<s%>, with which they have <S%H631>bound<s%> their <S%H5315>souls<s%>, shall stand against <S%H6965>her<s%>.
And if she <S%H5087>vowed<s%> in her <S%H376>husband<s%>'s <S%H1004>house<s%>, or <S%H631>bound<s%> her <S%H5315>soul<s%> by a <S%H632>bond<s%> with an <S%H7621>oath<s%>;

And her <S%H376>husband<s%> <S%H8085>heard<s%> <S%H2790>it<s%>, and held his peace at <S%H5106>her<s%>, and disallowed her <S%H5088>not<s%>: then all her vows shall <S%H6965>stand<s%>, and every <S%H632>bond<s%> with which she <S%H631>bound<s%> her <S%H5315>soul<s%> shall <S%H6965>stand<s%>.

But if her <S%H376>husband<s%> has <S%H6565>utterly<s%> made them <S%H6565>void<s%> on the <S%H3117>day<s%> he <S%H8085>heard<s%> <S%H4161>them<s%>; then whatever proceeded out of her <S%H8193>lips<s%> concerning her <S%H5088>vows<s%>, or concerning the <S%H632>bond<s%> of her <S%H5315>soul<s%>, shall not <S%H6965>stand<s%>: her <S%H376>husband<s%> has made them <S%H6565>void<s%>; and the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> shall forgive <S%H5545>her<s%>.

Every <S%H5088>vow<s%>, and every <S%H632>binding<s%> <S%H7621>oath<s%> to <S%H6031>afflict<s%> the <S%H5315>soul<s%>, her <S%H376>husband<s%> may <S%H6965>establish<s%> <S%H376>it<s%>, or her husband may make it <S%H6565>void<s%>.

But if her <S%H376>husband<s%> <S%H2790>altogether<s%> hold his <S%H2790>peace<s%> at her from <S%H3117>day<s%> to <S%H3117>day<s%>; then he <S%H6965>establishes<s%> all her <S%H5088>vows<s%>, or all her <S%H632>bonds<s%>, which are upon <S%H6965>her<s%>: he confirms <S%H2790>them<s%>, because he held his peace at her in the <S%H3117>day<s%> that he heard <S%H8085>them<s%>.
But if he shall any <S%H6565>ways<s%> make them <S%H6565>void<s%> <S%H310>after<s%> that he has <S%H8085>heard<s%> <S%H5375>them<s%>; then he shall carry her <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>.

These are the <S%H2706>statutes<s%>, which the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> <S%H6680>commanded<s%> <S%H4872>Moses<s%>, between a <S%H376>man<s%> and his <S%H802>wife<s%>, between the <S%H1>father<s%> and his <S%H1323>daughter<s%>, being yet in her <S%H5271>youth<s%> in her <S%H1>father<s%>'s <S%H1004>house<s%>.
